div.l: And had hem hangid in the rof aboue
And that he praide hem for godis loue
To sit in the roof par companye
The folke ganne to laughe at his fantasie
And to the roof thei kykyn and they gape .
And turnyd al his harme in to a iape .
For what so this Carpynt̉er euere answeride
Hit was for nought noman his resou herde
With othis grete . he was so swore a doune .
That he was holde . wod thurgh out al the toune
For eủery clerke anon right ther hilde with othir
And saide the man was wode my leue brothir
And eủery wight gan laughe . faste of this strif
Thus swyuyd was . the Carpinteres wif
For al his keping and his . gelosie .
And absolou hath kist hir nethir ieie
This tale is I dounThis tale is I doun And Nicholas is scaldid sore in his towte
This tale is doun and god saue al this rowte / Amen
¶ Explicit fabula molendinarij
Whenne folke had lawghe at this niys cas
Of absolon and hende Nicholas
Diủerse folke diủersly they seide
But for the moste ꝑparte they lowe and pleide
Ne at this tale I saw no man hym greue
But hit were only oswolde the reue
Bi cause he was of Carpynt̉eres crafte
A litil Ire in his herte lafte
He ganne to gruche and blamyd hit alite
SothSothSo thek quoth he ful well I couth hym quite
With blering of proude myllers iee
Yif that me list to speke of Ribaudie
But ik am olde me liste nat pleie for age
Gras tyme is don my fodir is now for age
Mi white top̄pe writeth myn olde yeres
Myn hert is so mowlid as is myn heris
But yif fare as dothe an opyn ars
Whiche fruite for sothe is eủer longe the wers
Till hit be rotyn in molk mollokmolk mollok othir in stre
We olde me I rede drede rede drede so fare we
Till we be rotyn we conne nat be ripe
We hopyn al al ay while the worlde wole pipe
